security_audit.summary: Documentation and validation skill with no code execution capabilities. The included Python validation script reads and validates command files using only Python standard library functions. No network calls, no external command execution, no environment variable access. Filesystem access is limited to reading files specified as command-line arguments.

content.user_title: Create slash commands for Claude Code
content.value_statement: Users need a way to create standardized, validated slash commands for their Claude Code workflows. This skill provides expert guidance on command structure, YAML schema, argument handling, and security best practices, including a validation script to ensure commands meet quality standards before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Creates Claude Code slash commands with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown body
Validates command schema including naming conventions, field formats, and tool permissions
Provides templates and patterns for common command types (git, testing, scaffolding)
Documents security considerations including input validation and path sanitization
Offers guidance on argument handling with $1, $2, and $ARGUMENTS variables
Includes migration patterns for updating commands to current schema standards
limitations: Does not execute the slash commands it creates - only provides documentation and validation
Requires Claude Code environment to use the generated commands
Security validation is advisory - does not prevent unsafe commands from being written
Cannot validate commands that require external API integrations or credentials

use_cases.title: Build plugin commands
use_cases.description: Create standardized slash commands for plugins following marketplace conventions and validation requirements

use_cases.title: Standardize team workflows
use_cases.description: Define shared slash commands for common team operations like deployments, code reviews, and testing

use_cases.title: Create automation commands
use_cases.description: Build parameterized commands for infrastructure tasks, deployments, and system maintenance operations

prompt_templates.title: New command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a slash command called run-tests that runs the test suite and reports results. Use the haiku model for fast execution. Include argument handling for specifying test paths.

prompt_templates.title: Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the command at .claude/commands/my-command.md using the validation script and show me any errors or recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate my command that uses model: haiku to use the correct version alias format for commands.

prompt_templates.title: Security hardening
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my command that uses Bash tool and suggest security improvements for input validation and path sanitization.

output_examples.input: Create a slash command called create-component that generates React components with TypeScript
output: Allowed tools: Read, Write, Grep, Glob

best_practices: Use version aliases (claude-haiku-4-5) or full IDs (claude-haiku-4-5-20251001) for model field - short aliases like haiku cause API errors in commands
Start with minimal tool permissions (Read, Grep, Glob) and only add Write, Edit, or Bash when truly necessary
Document all arguments with argument-hint field and explain $1, $2, and $ARGUMENTS usage in the command body
anti_patterns: Using short model aliases (haiku, sonnet, opus) in commands - they cause 'model not found' errors
Including both Write and Edit tools when the command only needs one file operation type
Using $ARGUMENTS directly in bash commands without validation - this creates command injection risk

faq.question: What models work in slash commands?
faq.answer: Commands require version aliases like claude-haiku-4-5 or full IDs like claude-haiku-4-5-20251001. Short aliases (haiku, sonnet, opus) only work in agents, not commands.

faq.question: What is the maximum command name length?
faq.answer: Command names must be 64 characters or less, using only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. Underscores and spaces are not allowed.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for project-level commands?
faq.answer: Yes. Commands can be created at project level (.claude/commands/), user level (~/.claude/commands/), or plugin level (plugin-dir/commands/).

faq.question: Is the validation script safe to run?
faq.answer: Yes. The validation script only reads files and reports results. It does not modify files, execute external commands, or access the network.

faq.question: Why does my command fail with model not found?
faq.answer: Commands use short aliases differently than agents. Change model: haiku to model: claude-haiku-4-5 or remove the model field entirely to inherit from conversation.

faq.question: How is this different from building agents?
faq.answer: Commands are user-triggered workflows with arguments. Agents are independent subagents with dedicated context. Use commands for discrete actions, agents for complex multi-step tasks.
